abstract: “The Voice” returned on Monday and soared back to the top of the ratings with a 4.7 rating among the target audience of viewers between the age of 18 and 49, and 13.4 million viewers. “Revolution” was also a winner at 10 p.m., averaging a 2.7 rating in the 18-49 group with about 7.2 million viewers.
snippet: “The Voice” returned on Monday and soared back to the top of the ratings with a 4.7 rating among the target audience of viewers between the age of 18 and 49, and 13.4 million viewers. “Revolution” was also a winner at 10 p.m., averaging a 2.7 rati...
lead_paragraph: NBC had a lot riding on the comeback of its twin hits from the fall — “The Voice” and “Revolution” — with “The Voice,” in particular, taking a big chance by coming back for a second arc in the same season (no singing competition had done that before) and with a new lineup of judges.

headline.main: NBC Lures Back Viewers With ‘The Voice’ and ‘Revolution’
